title: Dance-themed (Bollywood + Bharatanatyam) background on main page

requirements.summary: Apply a subtle, responsive Bollywood + Bharatanatyam themed background behind the existing main-page UI without altering functionality or reducing readability.
acceptanceCriteria: When the app loads, a dance-themed background is visible across the full main page behind the header/main/footer content.

The background includes recognizable visual cues of both Bollywood-themed dance and Bharatanatyam classical dance (e.g., silhouettes/poses, costume-inspired shapes, ornamental motifs) without using any text in the artwork.
Foreground UI components (cards, dropdown, text) remain readable; background does not overpower content (e.g., via opacity/blur/overlay treatment).
Background scales responsively across common viewport sizes without obvious tiling seams or distortion.

file_operations.description: Add a global CSS utility/class for the app shell that sets the generated background image as a full-viewport background (cover/center/no-repeat) and applies a subtle overlay treatment to maintain foreground readability (including dark mode), ensuring the background stays behind content.

Update the top-level app wrapper to use the new background CSS class while keeping existing layout, header/main/footer structure, and all product functionality unchanged (ensure content layers render above the background/overlay).

requirements.summary: Add the generated background image as a static frontend asset under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference it via CSS/background styling.
acceptanceCriteria: The generated image file(s) exist under frontend/public/assets/generated with the exact filenames specified in this build request.
The main page uses the generated asset(s) via CSS/background styling and the app builds successfully without missing-asset errors.

file_operations.description: Add the generated wide background illustration asset at the exact required path/filename: frontend/public/assets/generated/dance-background.dim_1920x1080.png.
Reference the static asset frontend/public/assets/generated/dance-background.dim_1920x1080.png from the background styling so it is loaded directly by the frontend build (not through the backend).
